description: Minor Material Amendment (S.73) to vary condition 2, for addition of 3no. rooflights and 3no. PV panels to the western roofslope pursuant to planning permission 203074FUL dated 27/11/2020 for 'Conversion of commercial unit (Use Class A1) to self-contained flat (Use Class C3) (for total of two flats within building); associated amenity, cycle parking, and waste storage spaces; two-storey front extension; and installation of three (3) rooflights to side of main roofslope'.
site_name: Buildings Rear Of 31 To 36 Haven Green
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of the original permission (203074FUL).

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be retained in accordance with drawing title number(s): 20-029-E01 Existing OS Plan, 20-029-E02 Existing Site - Ground Floor Plan, 20-029-E03 Existing Site - First Floor Plan, 20-029-E04 Existing Roof Plan, 20-029-E05 Existing Street Elevation (Madeley Road), 20-029-E06 Existing Front Elevation (North Facing), 20-029-E07 Existing Side Elevation (East Facing), 20-029-P01 Proposed OS Plan, 20-029-P02 Proposed Site - Ground Floor Plan, 20-029-P03 Proposed Site - First Floor Plan, 20-029-P04 Proposed Roof Plan, 20-029-P05 Proposed Street Elevation (Madeley Road), 20-029-P06 Proposed Front Elevation (North Facing), 20-029-P07 Proposed Side Elevation (East Facing), Planning, Design & Access Statement prepared by Red & White dated August 2020.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building and shall be consistent with those as listed within the submitted application form and the drawings / plans as listed in Condition (2).

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Policies D3 & D4 of the London Plan (2021) and Policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7B of Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013), polices 1.1 (k) and 1.2 (f) of the adopted Development (Core) Strategy (2013). | Cycle storage for two (2) bicycle spaces shall be provided within the curtilage of the site (as per the site plan), within a secure, lockable compound in accordance with all adopted standards prior to occupation of the building and be continuously available and retained for the life of the development hereby approved.

Reason: To provide adequate bicycle storage to align with Sustainable Transport SPG and policy T5 of the London Plan (2021). | The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until refuse and recycling storage within an enclosure has been provided within the front garden of the property, in accordance with the Local Planning Authority Standards and has been fully implemented and made available for use. These facilities shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.

Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policies D4 and SI8 of the London Plan (2021). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (as amended), no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties and the visual appearance of the area, in accordance with policies 7.4, 7A, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policies D3, D4, D6 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021). | No part of the flat roofs of the hereby approved development shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof terrace/garden or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties and future occupiers of the development, in accordance with policies 7A ,7B and 7D of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013) and policy D6 of the London Plan (2021). | The window/s inserted in the side extension shall be obscure glazed and non-opening (where openable parts less than 1.7m above floor) unless otherwise confirmed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To safeguard neighbouring amenity from light pollution in accordance with policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD. | The proposed rooflights hereby approved shall be Conservation grade, not project more than 150mm from the roof plane and retained as such for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: To minimise light spillage and interference with the privacy and outlook of adjoining occupiers and in the interests of good neighbourliness and in accordance with policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and the Haven Green Conservation Area Management Plan. | The details of the aircraft noise assessment shall be carried out in accordance with the details previously approved under ref: 203310CND dated 06.08.2021.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by aircraft noise, in accordance with policy D14 of the London Plan (2021), policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), Local Variation policy 3.5 and policy 7A of Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | The external sound level emitted from plant, machinery or equipment at the development shall be lower than the lowest existing background sound level by at least 10dBA as measured at/ calculated to the nearest and/or most affected noise sensitive premises in order to prevent any adverse impact. The assessment shall be made in accordance with BS4142:2014, with all machinery operating together at maximum capacity.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with policy D14 of the London Plan (2021), policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), Local Variation policy 3.5 and policy 7A of Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | Prior to use, machinery, plant or equipment/ extraction/ ventilation system and ducting at the development shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced and maintained as such.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site and surrounding premises is not adversely affected by vibration, in accordance with policy D14 of the London Plan (2021), policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), Local Variation policy 3.5 and policy 7A of Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).
